flawed_nl_solution:
On the third day, there were one-third of the number of bedbugs as the fourth day, so there were 810 / 3 = <<810/3=207>>207 bedbugs.
On the second day, there were one-third of the third day's bedbugs, so there were 207 / 3 = <<207/3=69>>69 bedbugs.
On the first day, there were 69 / 3 = <<69/3=23>>23 bedbugs in the group to start with.
#### 23

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 270, not 207. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
